item.title: Tesla x RPI Application Workshop, Tech Talk, Networking to be Held February 19 at 2:00 pm
item.description: Tesla will host a session that will provide guidance on the resume-building and application process to help RPI students stand out! Immediately following the Tech Talk, Tesla will transition to a networking event in the DCC Great Hall where students can speak one-to-one with engineering managers. Seating is limited, so register in Handshake!

item.title: How to Stay Involved with RPI as an Alum
item.description: Wednesday, February 19, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Join our info session to learn how to stay involved as an alum. You will learn about the Office of Alumni Engagement, how to be an alumnus, alumni benefits, athletics & affinity groups, post graduation checklist, and more!

item.title: Game Development Club Presents Valentine’s Day Game Jam
item.description: Love is in the air! Join the RPI Game Development Club on February 14 at 6 p.m. in Sage 2411 for a Valentine’s Themed Game Jam, and make a Multiplayer Game in 48 hours to play with the special people in your life! Overnight breaks begin at 10:00 PM on both Friday and Saturday nights and doors re-opening at 8:00 AM each morning. Open to all RPI students! Contact Aiden Crossfield (crossa2@rpi.edu) to sign up.

item.title: Math Colloquium: Karl Pierce (Flatiron Institute) - February 19
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 19, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - This Mathematical Sciences Colloquium will feature a presentation titled “On the Utilization of Matrix-Free Tensor Decompositions in the Approximation of Accurate Tensor Algorithms” by Dr. Karl Pierce, Postdoctoral Research Fellow at the Flatiron Institute’s Center for Computational Quantum Physics.

item.title: Rensselaer Dining Welcomes New Catering Director
item.description: Rensselaer Dining is excited to announce Rebecca Hanesack as the new Director of Catering at RPI, bringing 25 years of hospitality experience to the role. During her studies at Siena College, Rebecca began her career in hospitality. Involved in nearly every operational and administrative support role, she gained a comprehensive understanding of the industry from the ground up.

item.title: Being & Becoming: Quartet led by trumpeter Peter Evans - Corrected Date: February 21
item.description: Friday, February 21, 2025 7:00 PM - All are invited! Being & Becoming, the quartet led by trumpeter Peter Evans, gives a standing-room-only concert featuring some of the most forward-thinking young musicians in Jazz and Contemporary music. Experience Being & Becoming live in the immersive EMPAC Studio 2 venue, with charged lighting design by Azumi O E heightening the alchemic creation and recreation of musical worlds onstage. Limited capacity. $5 in advance for RPI community.

item.title: “Whose Data Is It Anyway?” Celebrate #LoveData25
item.description: RPI Libraries celebrates Love Data Week 2025, an international data event held annually in February. This year’s theme, “Whose Data Is It Anyway?”, explores data ownership, provenance, and data collection. Libraries worldwide are hosting events with workshops, talks, and games. Love Data Week aims to raise awareness about data literacy and responsible data use. Find out more about International Love Data Week.
item.author: Community

item.title: Spring Lunch and Learn Series: Helping Students Learn
item.description: Faculty are invited to a spring Lunch and Learn Series on Helping Students Learn. This is a 3-part series on research-based teaching theories and methods. The first session will be on February 26 with a focus on Accessing Prior Knowledge—Preparing Students to Learn New Material. Registration is limited. The series is sponsored by the MANE Department and funded by the National Science Foundation grant # 2235345, NSF IUSE/PFE:RED A&I Curriculum integration through collaborative teaching and mentoring: adapting an integrated system for engineering formation

item.title: DotCIO anounces a new employee request form for technology needs
item.description:
DotCIO has released a new employee request form for technology needs available in their IT Services and Support Center (ITSSC) request system. This form is a centralized request for technology needs for new hires, including transferring from a different Division, such as computer/laptop, software, network and shared resources access, printers, and phone requirements.
